text:
Say I have a function
```function print_squares_over(n)
  square(a) = a^2//n
  for a in 1:n
    println(square(a))
  end
end```
of this type with my inner function a bit more complicated, and the outer function called lots of time. Can I expect julia to inline the inner function, or in general be efficient about it?

elements.text:
function print_squares_over(n)
  square(a) = a^2//n
  for a in 1:n
    println(square(a))
  end
end
of this type with my inner function a bit more complicated, and the outer function called lots of time. Can I expect julia to inline the inner function, or in general be efficient about it?

text: Yes, you can. I don't know if there are some edge cases, but in general it'll work like an external function

elements.text: Yes, you can. I don't know if there are some edge cases, but in general it'll work like an external function
